medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain began after aorto-bifem bypass surgery and started as intermittent sharp epigastric pain that was mild and lasted for a day or two. This pain did not seem related to eating or drinking and had no aggravating factors. Over the past few months, the pain has increased in severity, culminating in a very severe episode of abdominal pain radiating to the left upper quadrant that has been constant for 3 days. The patient experienced nausea and vomiting, unable to keep anything down, and had not had a bowel movement for 4 days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Opioid use disorder on Suboxone, chronic lumbosacral radiculopathy s/p spinal cord stimulator, chronic HCV s/p Harvoni, tobacco use disorder, history of bilateral iliac artery occlusion s/p aorto-bifem bypass.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of aortic disease or sudden death.
